revised_title: Experimental Researches on the Constancy of Electrochemical Action and the Development of a Volta-Electrometer
tldr: Faraday investigates the constancy of electrochemical action on water and develops a volta-electrometer to measure the quantity of electricity. The instrument is capable of measuring both the primary and secondary results of electrochemical reactions, providing a valuable tool for studying the effects of electric currents on various solutions.
